lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pUrn bHm dyKy diRsit kY gurmuiK sbd kY pUrn bHm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Pooran Braham Daykhay Drisati Kai , Gurmukhi Sabad Kai Pooran Braham Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: An obedient Sikh of the Guru sees the Lord pervading everywhere. By his utterances and expressions, he shows His presence to others as well.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pUrn bHm sRuiq s√çn kY mDur bcn kih bynqI ibsm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Pooran Braham Srouti Sravan Kai , Madhur Bachan Kahi Baynatee Bisam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru's obedient slave hears the melodious sound of the complete God with his own ears by his very sweetly spoken words. He makes supplications which have marvellous sweetness in them.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pUrn bHm rs gMD sMiD pRys rs cMdn sugMD gmwgm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Pooran Braham Ras Gandh Sandhi , Prays Ras Chandan Sougandh Gamaagam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-conscious person always relishes the elixir of Lord's name even if he is lured by the combined attractions of his sense of smell and taste. The wondrous elixir obtained as a result of his love for the Lord is far more fragrant than the Sandalwood.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pUrn bHm gur srb mY gurmuiK pUrn bHm nmo nm hY ]152]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Pooran Braham Gur Sarab Mai , Gurmukhi Pooran Braham Namo Nam Hai ?152?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-oriented person considers the True Guru as a form of all-pervading Lord God. He makes his salutations and supplications to him again and again. (152)
